Name: Gold Phantom
Instructions: Select and pre-chill an Old-fashioned glass .
Prepare garnish of pineapple wedge and silver dragees (cake making balls)..
Review: Fruity and refreshing with cognac, pineapple, lemon and vanilla liqueur.
History: Created in 2015 by Matthew Soares at Cloud 23, Hilton Manchester, England. Talking about his inspiration for making this drink, Matthew said, “In 1884, when Henry Royce opened his first workshop in Hulme, Manchester, did he ever dream his firm would one day produce a magnificent Rolls Royce Phantom plated in solid gold? Valued at £5 million, it is considered one of the world's most expensive super-car’. Each ingredient in my drink is, or was, considered a sign of luxury and wealth. The silver dragees I used to garnish my drink represent the bearings of the car.”
